title: Brain-damaged woman hit by a bus will spend compensation on IVF to 'give her life meaning'
text:
A severely brain-damaged woman has been given permission to pay for IVF treatment after claiming that having a baby will give her life more meaning.

The woman, who is in her 30s, was left with reduced mental capacity and other health problems after she was hit by a bus in 2012.

She was awarded £2.5million in compensation after suing a bus company over the accident.

The woman, from China, was studying in London when she was struck by the vehicle but now lives with her parents in her home country, her lawyers said.

On Friday a judge granted her permission to spend some of her compensation on IVF treatment, a process of fertilisation where an egg is combined with sperm outside the body.
description: A severely brain-damaged woman has been given permission to pay for IVF treatment after claiming that having a baby will give her life more meaning.
